result.execSummary:
The deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Rodney J. Schmidt is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13
1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 12

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rodney J. Schmidt

records.addlTxt: 03:37 PM Defendant Rodney J. Schmidt in court with attorney Christopher T. Van Wagner.  Rick Spoentgen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and appearances.  Court makes record re: error in previous alford plea.  Court notes it's a defective plea to be addressed today as opposed to a MH to address the DPA.  Atty Van Wagner provides CSR to the Court as the parties have reached a resolution in this matter as well as the new file 22CF48.  State notes victim rights have been complied with and the victim in this case had no strong feelings either way and said she'd leave it up to the judge and the attorneys.  Court cites the agreement as noted in the CSR would dismiss the charges in 15CF151 so the defective plea would not need to be deal with.  Parties are in agreement.  State moves to dismiss.  Atty Van Wagner is in agreement.  Court grants dismissal.

Atty Van Wagner received a copy of the motion to revoke DPA.  State requests matter be reset to allow them to contact the State.  Atty Van Wagner does not object.  Atty Van Wagner would like a week after the State decides if they are futher pursuing this matter to file any response to the motion.  Bond continues.  Motion hearing scheduled for January 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Case removed from electronic filing process
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Review at 09-28-2020 08:00 am

Defendant Rodney J. Schmidt in court with attorney Christopher T. Van Wagner.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  State notes an agreement has been reached to a DPA.  Atty VanWagner is in agreement and Alford Plea/NC entered to Ct 1 although he maintains he's not guilty.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on plea.  State states their offer of proof.  Court accepts plea and finds DE guilty although there is no formal finding of guilty at this time and the DPA is approved for 5 years.  Count 2 is dismissed.  Review scheduled for September 28, 2020 at 08:00 am.

Defendant Rodney J. Schmidt in court with attorney Christopher T. Van Wagner.   appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Stands Mute, Court enters Not Guilty Plea, set for trial br. 3.  Bond continues.
Arraignment at 06-24-2015 01:00 pm

Defendant Rodney J. Schmidt in court with attorney Christopher T. Van Wagner.  Linda A. Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 1.  Set arraignment out about 30 days.  Arraignment scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing at 05-29-2015 11:00 am

no contact w/SLC or KWC or TKC; No unsupervised contact w/any females under 18
Preliminary hearing at 05-22-2015 09:30 am

Defendant Rodney J. Schmidt in court with attorney Christopher T. Van Wagner.  Linda A. Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  State requests bond from prior case be applied to this matter.  Atty VanWagner objects and explains why.  $2,500.00 cash bond continued from 14CF!04 to this case.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Booking today and no contact w/SLC (dob 10/1/2001) KWC or TKC.  No unsupervised contact w/any females under 18 years of age.  Booking today.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 09:30 am.
